instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message:
Hello!

An old board this 820-2327, I know, but I'm still practicing...

Fan spins for 11 secs, stops for a second and then spins endlessly. I get light  by plugging a USB mouse. PPCPUVTT_S0 is 1.06V.
PPVCORE_S0_MCP_REG is 1.08V and SMC_MCP_CORE_ISENSE is 0.20V.

What should I measure next?

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: USB mouse lights on both USB ports?

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: Seems to be alive then? Anything on the LCD? Check with flashlight

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: No image on the LCD with flashlight. No image over DisplayPort. I touch the laser under the mouse and every time the red light goes brighter...

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: Does it chime? Speaker in the case (4 pin) needs to be connected. Any history on this board? Liquid?

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: No chime. Bought the macbook cheap on ebay. Removed the speaker that is glued to the logic board and it revealed some mild corrosion here and there. The rest of the board is clean.

threads.title: 820-2327 fan spinning, no chime
threads.message: Inspect closer for liquid, but the fact that it turns on then off and then on again is worrying. This usually happens when there is no CPU Vcore or when the MCP is dead.
